description.en:
The subject will cover general theory for survival models, including:
* survival function, its empirical estimates (Kaplan-Meier, Fleming-Harrington) and construction of confidence intervals
* fitting most common parametric distributions to survival data
* Cox proportional hazards model, accelerated failure time model
* multistate models, introduction to continuous-time Markov chains, Cox-Markov model
description.et:
Kursus annab ülevaate elukestusmudelite teooriast, sh
* elukestusfunktsioon, selle empiirilised hinnangud (Kaplan-Meier, Fleming-Harrington), usaldusintervallide leidmine
* olulisemate parameetriliste jaotuste sobitamine elukestusandmetele
* Coxi võrdeliste riskide mudel, kiirendatud tõrkeaja mudel
* mitme olekuga mudelid, pideva ajaga Markovi ahelate tutvustus, Cox-Markovi mudel

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide a systematic overview of  survival models used  in life insurance.
objectives.et: Anda süstemaatiline ülevaade elukindlustuses kasutatavatest  elukestuse mudelitest.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course a participant
1. understands the concept of main functions used in survival analysis (survival function, hazard function, cumulative hazard, etc);
learning_outcomes.et: 1. saab aru põhiliste elukestusanalüüsis kasutatavate funtsioonide olemusest (elukestusfunktsioon, riskifunktsioon, kumulatiivne riskifunktsioon, jms);

learning_outcomes.en: 3. can describe systems with several states in terms of Markov chains and estimate its transition probabilities.
learning_outcomes.et: 3. oskab kirjeldada mitme seisundiga juhuslike süsteeme Markovi ahelate abil ning hinnata Markovi ahela üleminekutõenäosusi.

description.et: At least 60% points from home assignments obtained.
Test consisting of theroetical and practical questions.

grade_preconditions.et: At least 60% points from home assignments obtained.

grade_evaluation.et:
Home assignments + test consisting of theroetical and practical questions.
The more home assignments one has completed, the less questions one needs to answer in final test.

resources.recommended_materials:
* Tableman, M. & Kim, J.S. (2003). Survival Analysis Using S - Analysis of Time-To-Event Data. Chapman & Hall / CRC.
* Meira-Machado, L., de Una-Alvarez, J., Cardarso-Suarez, C. & Andersen, P.K. (2009). Multi-state models for the analysis of time to event data. Statistical methods in medical research, 18(2), 195--222.
* Hougaard, P. (2012). Analysis of multivariate survival data. Springer.

description.et: 2. Estimators for empirical survival function. Kaplan-Meier estimator, Fleming-Harrington estimator.
3. Confidence intervals for Kaplan-Meier estimator. Comparison of survival functions.
4. Fitting parametric distributions to survival data.
5. Cox proportional hazards model. Accelerated failure time model.
6. AIC procedure. Residuals for Cox proportional hazards model.
7. Multistate models (MSM). Continuous time Markov chains.
2. Calculating estimations for empirical survival function.
4. Fitting parametric distributions to survival data.
5. Fitting models with covariates (parametric models, Cox proportional hazards model, accelerated failure time model)
8. Fitting multistate models 2 (competing risks model, time-dependent covariates).
